
```{python}
#| label: victory-bonds-returns
#| fig-cap: "VICTORY Bonds: 40% Perpetual Returns"

import sys
sys.path.insert(0, 'c:/code/decentralized-institutes-of-health')

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from brain.charts._chart_style import (
    setup_chart_style, add_watermark, clean_spines,
    COLOR_LIGHT, COLOR_MID, COLOR_ACCENT, COLOR_DARK, COLOR_WHITE, COLOR_BG
)

# Setup styling
setup_chart_style(style='light', dpi=150)

# Data
investments = ['S&P 500', 'Real Estate', 'Venture\nCapital', 'Medallion\nFund', 'VICTORY\nBonds']
returns = [10, 15, 25, 39, 40]
colors_investments = [COLOR_LIGHT, COLOR_LIGHT, COLOR_LIGHT, COLOR_MID, COLOR_ACCENT]

# Create chart
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(14, 10))
bars = ax.barh(investments, returns, color=colors_investments, height=0.6, edgecolor=COLOR_WHITE, linewidth=2)

# Add value labels
for bar, ret in zip(bars, returns):
    width = bar.get_width()
    ax.text(width, bar.get_y() + bar.get_height()/2.,
            f'  {ret}%', ha='left', va='center', fontsize=44, weight='bold',
            color=COLOR_DARK)

ax.set_xlabel('Annual Returns', fontsize=36, weight='bold', color=COLOR_DARK)
ax.tick_params(axis='y', labelsize=36, colors=COLOR_DARK)
ax.tick_params(axis='x', labelsize=28, colors=COLOR_MID)
ax.set_xlim(0, 50)
clean_spines(ax)
ax.grid(axis='x', alpha=0.3, linestyle='--', color=COLOR_LIGHT)

# Add branding
add_watermark(fig)

#plt.tight_layout()  # Disabled - using rcParams margins instead
plt.savefig('assets/charts/victory-bonds-returns.png', dpi=150, bbox_inches=None, facecolor=COLOR_BG)
plt.show()
```

**Key Insight:** VICTORY Bonds offer **40% annual perpetual returns**, beating even the legendary Medallion Fund (39%). Only $3.375B total issuance makes them scarce and valuable.
